segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor, pooling around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long the faucet has been running like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t slipped yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to something, but she’s too focused to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting to warn her, but she seems so calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her and the chaos around her is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets if it keeps flowing like this.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll even react when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
